intro: Albuca scabromarginata, commonly known as the rough-marginled albuca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are often covered in a powdery coating. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers during the summer months. It is a succulent, adapted to arid environments, and requires well-draining soil and minimal water. Albuca scabromarginata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ease of care.
